content: In 10 seconds you will be redirected to the <1>{{productName}}</1>

comment.text: This translation key is used for a countdown message displayed on an error screen after invalid input, redirecting the user to the product name in 10 seconds. It appears as a notification component, likely a button or dialog overlay. Translators should provide a time-sensitive message that informs users of an upcoming redirection.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'y√∂nl…ôndiril…ôc…ôksiniz' directly translates to 'will be redirected' but lacks the nuance of 'you will be redirected to'. The English emphasizes *where* they are being redirected.
The formatting tags (<1> and </1>) are identical in both the English and Azerbaijani versions. Ensure this is intentional and consistent with the platform/system using these tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, but verify consistency across all translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "In 10 seconds you will be redirected to the" is best translated as "En 10 segundos ser√° redirigido/a a..." or "Dentro de 10 segundos ser√° redirigido/a a...". "Dentro de 10 segundos se le redirigir√° a..." is grammatically correct but less common and sounds slightly more formal or distant. "Se le redirigir√°" can sound passive and less direct.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: En 10 segundos ser√° redirigido/a a la p√°gina de <1>{{productName}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '10 sekunnin kuluttua sinut ohjataan' doesn't quite convey the 'In 10 seconds you will be redirected' part accurately. A more natural Finnish phrasing would be 'Sinut ohjataan <1>{{productName}}</1> 10 sekunnin kuluttua' or 'Ohjataan sinut <1>{{productName}}</1> 10 sekunnin kuluttua'. The current translation puts the '10 seconds' awkwardly at the beginning of the redirection.
The formatting tags <1> and </1> are preserved in the translation, which is expected, but it's good to note for consistency and to ensure the translators are aware of the intention.

The English phrase "you will be redirected to" is not accurately translated. The Japanese translation "„Å´„É™„ÉÄ„Ç§„É¨„ÇØ„Éà„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô" directly translates to "will be redirected to" but lacks the implied agency or action performed by a system. A more natural phrasing would convey the redirecting *is being done*.

The translation '10Ï¥à ÎÇ¥Ïóê <1>{{productName}}</1>Î°ú Î¶¨ÎîîÎ†âÏÖòÎê©ÎãàÎã§' doesn't fully convey the meaning of 'In 10 seconds you will be redirected to the <1>{{productName}}</1>'.  A more natural and accurate translation would indicate *who* is being redirected.  'Î°ú' implies movement *to* something, but doesn't explicitly state 'you'.

The original content uses '<1>{{productName}}</1>'. The Korean translation uses the same formatting. This appears consistent, so no change is strictly necessary, but consider if this is standard practice and if it is conveying the intended meaning (e.g., a specific tag or identifier for productName).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Maintain consistency with original formatting. Verify purpose of tags.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'redirected to' is better translated as 'pƒÅrvests uz' or 'virzƒ´ts uz' rather than simply 'novirzƒ´ts uz'. While 'novirzƒ´ts uz' isn't wrong, it's not the most natural sounding translation in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pƒìc 10 sekundƒìm j≈´s tiksiet pƒÅrvests uz <1>{{productName}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence "Over 10 seconden wordt u doorverwezen" sounds slightly awkward in Dutch. A more natural phrasing would be "Na 10 seconden wordt u..."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Na 10 seconden wordt u doorverwezen naar de <1>{{productName}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The possessive pronoun 'your' is missing. The English text uses 'you will be redirected', implying the redirection is for the user. The Portuguese translation 'ser√° redirecionado' is passive and doesn't convey the same personalized experience.  It should be translated to reflect the user being redirected.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Em 10 segundos voc√™ ser√° redirecionado para a <1>{{productName}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The character ëá™ (Devanagari letter 'ra') appears to be used incorrectly. It doesn't fit the context and is likely a typo.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace ëá™ with the appropriate Sinhala character representing 'dalam'. Considering the context, it should be a time indicator, perhaps 'dalam'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation '‡∑Ñ‡∑ú‡∂∂‡∑Ä ‡∑Ñ‡∂ª‡∑Ä‡∑è ‡∂∫‡∑Ä‡∂±‡∑î ‡∂Ω‡∑ê‡∂∂‡∑ö' is overly literal and doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala. A more idiomatic translation for 'redirected to' is needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like '‡∂î‡∂∂‡∑Ä <1>{{productName}}</1> ‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂≠ ‡∂∫‡∑ú‡∂∏‡∑î ‡∂ö‡∂ª‡∂±‡∑î ‡∂Ω‡∑ê‡∂∂‡∑ö' or '‡∂î‡∂∂‡∑Ä <1>{{productName}}</1> ‡∑Ä‡∑ô‡∂≠ ‡∂∫‡∂±‡∑î ‡∂Ω‡∑ê‡∂∂‡∑ö'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are unusual. They might need clarification or a standard format should be used consistently across all translations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify if these tags are intentional and aligned with the project's requirements. If not, use standard HTML tags or remove them altogether based on the required output format.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word '–±–∏—ÜÃÅ–µ—Ç–µ' is not the standard or most natural way to express 'you will be' in this context. While technically understandable, it sounds slightly awkward.

The English phrase 'you will be redirected to' is translated as 'y√∂nlendirileceksiniz', which is grammatically correct but sounds a bit abrupt and formal in Turkish. A more natural phrasing would be '... sayfasƒ±na y√∂nlendirileceksiniz' (to the page of...).

The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are present in both the English and Chinese versions.  While technically correct in preserving the formatting, it's unclear what their purpose is and if they should be removed or replaced with a more standard HTML tag (e.g., `<span>`) or removed entirely, depending on the context of their intended use.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the purpose of `<1>` and `</1>` tags.  Consider replacing them with a more standard HTML tag (e.g., `<span>`) or removing them if they are not semantically necessary.
